result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth James Gerhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Original Warrant has been received and destroyed

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Christina at GLSO.
43

10:27 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to the charge with jail, restitution and court costs.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-9 months county jail, with huber if not sentenced to prison.
-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Restitution - $181.00
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:34 a.m.

Note:  After court Judge said the defendant's sentence is to commence immediately.
Clark County Jail - 02/16/2016 at 9:30 a.m. (Plea & Sentencing)
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-16-2016 10:00 am

1:32 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not have a copy of the criminal complaint.  Defendant now confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Violent Contact with Rondelle P.  Court will set for Status Hearing on August 25, 2015 at 9:15 am.

Court adjourned at 1:35 p.m.
